ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish

comments: Exposure to other field of research; it requires you to think about your topic, although I felt there was a little too much emphasis on writing grant proposals.
The receptiveness of Prof Skelly, and the clarity on how to deal with the milestones of the PhD

Dave oriented the course around things we should be doing anyway (lit review, funding proposals, etc) and gave us enough flexibility to have the course feed into our own work, whatever stage we were at.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I would suggest more information on the following topics:(1) resources that Yale has to offer graduate students and how to find out about these,e.g., grant-writing classes, other writing classes, workshops in SAS, R, ArcGIS.(2) applied organizational skills, e.g., any suggestions or software for organizing/tracking the thousands of pdfs on my computer so I can access and cite them when I need them? Maybe current graduate students could talk about their coping skills?(3) other skills, e.g., role of literature search, guidelines for how to conduct a literature search and select relevant articles/information.(4) thinking about the future: if a student is 100% committed to going into academia, maybe she has a different set of priorities in her graduate career than a student that is open to (or even prefers) options outside academia, such as government/EPA, a thinktank, UN, etc. Publications may be much more important for getting an academic job than a government job, for example. I don't know if there are any useful suggestions here, but if there are I'd like to hear them.
Getting the doctoral advisers involved more...perhaps a lecture each, or expanding the seminar to a year lone seminar wherein students pursue a year long project

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I think its a crucial step to contextualizing doctoral research and is a great course to have in the 1st semester of the program

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
Did it live up to your expectations?
Did you get out of it what you expected?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Spend time on the project, its the best thing for you.. this course is a great doctoral course since it gives you time and space to think about your ideas and sound them off to people in the department
